name: Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Punta Cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an all inclusive resort and would be a haven for golfers and drinkers which neither my husband or I are. The beach was gorgeous but the waters were a bit rough and too dangerous for anything more than wading in the waves. It's a long ride into town and to and from the airport. The music in the main lobby area was too loud for my taste and I would have enjoyed a more local experience. Eating had many choices. My favorite was the Toro restaurant. There is a double jacuzzi in every room which is great for couples. If I went again I would take the 7 hour tour called the Dominican experience.
reviews.title: Punta Cana

reviews.text: If you are Palace Premier Members, like us, this may be most useful for you. We were a party of six, with our kids and my wife's parents.
reviews.title: Palace Members: once you've straightened out the problems, it's very nice.

reviews.text: As you know, we all get promised an elite level of service when we sign up as members. But often, there are problems in getting the resort to provide what you have been promised. This was our experience; we spent the first 24+ hours fighting to get the benefits outlined in our contract. I will say that they eventually made good on everything that we requested, and our butler Verenise Liria did an amazing job of making things come together.
reviews.title: Awesome trip!
"over the top" done well, but...
reviews.text: Once we were through this, we had no issues. The resort is vast but beautiful, probably best suited for the young at heart. The rooms are luxurious and Spa and Golf were excellent. The staff was friendly, courteous and responsive. I would say that the food was good, but got very repetitive.
Palace needs to do a better job of delivering on the expectations they create. Problems can be fixed, but the stress created is no way to start a family vacation.
reviews.title: Check In was very easy!

reviews.text: I went to the Hard Rock for Feb break with my husband, mother and 2 boys (aged 13 and 15). Overall, the place was nice. The rooms were nice and big. We were told that we would have 2 rooms next door to each other but when we checked in, although they were in the same building, were not near each other. After making a stink, we got our rooms next door to each other. Building 6 is a great location which is near the lobby and the restaurants and spa. ALthough it was far from the beach, the shuttles ran frequently and didn't mind it.
reviews.title: There are better resorts

reviews.text: The food was absolutely horrible. The only 2 restaurants that were good was the hibachi and the brick oven pizza. In our family, we each had dietary restriction so it was very difficult to explain to the waitstaff what we wanted due to the language barrier. The food was mostly pre-made so it was hard to have certain ingredients left out.
reviews.title: They overbook the resort on purpose!

reviews.text: The language barrier was very difficult. If you do not speak Spanish, it is hard to get your point across to the people who work there unless it was at the check in desk or to book tours/spa treament. The people who clean your room do not understand English. They never left us enough towels for 3 people in the room and had to ask for more towels daily.
reviews.title: Will not return.

reviews.text: The resort credit was a gimmick. SInce we had 2 rooms, we had a total of $3000 to use. What a joke. We were only able to use $300 per room for spa treatments. After that, we had to pay for anything over that. Golf was unlimited as well as tours which did not impress us. The tours that did seem like alot of fun was not included in the credit so you had to pay for it. You could upgrade your wine using the credits but on 2 occasions I asked for a certain wine and they said (20 minutes later) that they did not have it. I thought that was strange since I saw the bottle I wanted at each restaurant.
reviews.title: A huge resort with lots of attractions, excursions, fun pools and a beautiful beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools and beach were fine. The only down side was that they did not have any water activities at the beach.(i.e. snorkeling, banana boat, sailing, etc).
reviews.title: LOVED MY TRIP!! An honest review

reviews.text: Just returned from a week at the Hard Rock Punta Cana. I will try to put aside the fact that it was overrun with obnoxious college kids a majority of the week (It reminded me not to travel during spring break!) and try to give my best rundown of the place.
reviews.title: Great staff, but just too big!

reviews.text: It was my 4th time to the DR, we took a little girls trip and let me tell you, this resort is gorgeous! Sadly, it is just TOO big. It took atleast 10 minutes to get from our room to the pool, or the main lobby. Sure there are trams but it's either wait 15minutes for those or walk your butt off all week.
reviews.title: If you are spring breaker this is your paradise..

reviews.text: The rooms are nice, jacuzzi in the middle, decent beds, always clean. Loved the huge walk-in shower! Found it odd that nearly every toilet / bathroom lock in the resort was broke considering it holds such high star & diamond ratings. (Nitpicky, I know. But just being honest)
reviews.title: Four years old still needs work

reviews.text: The staff was amazing, from bartenders to servers to entertainment staff - they were all super friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Management

reviews.text: All of the restaurants were delicious (and yes, we tried them all!) Toro, the steakhouse, had cuts of meat better than some of the steakhouses back home. We had breakfast nearly every morning at Toro, it was a lot less crowded than the buffet in the main building. Lunch was eaten by the pool (we loved that they brought the food to you! Pure pampering)
reviews.title: Previous reviews had me worried!

reviews.text: This was our 3rd trip to the Hard Rock in less than one year. Once again, PARADISE!!! I have read many reviews on this resort, and can never figure out what anyone could complain about. The resort, grounds, people, casino, beach, etc are all excellent! It was even at full capacity and there were no problems!
reviews.title: Paradise Revisited

reviews.text: Arrival: Airport was PACKED! Took about 1 hour to get through customs, but Hard Rock transportation was ready and waiting to take us to the resort.
reviews.title: Looks fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in: About 15 minutes, and we were off to the room. No problems!
reviews.title: Great Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: Absolutely beautiful! Our room attendent took great care of us all week.
reviews.title: Five star rooms, one star service

reviews.text: Pools: We mostly stayed at the Eden Pool. It was our 3rd visit, so we knew Juan, Francisco, Emilio, Salanye, and Yeberki by name. Once again, they took great care of us. Can't wait to go back and see our friends there soon!
reviews.title: Most excellent vacation!

aka: Hard Rock Hotel And Casino Punta Cana
description: The 1,787 room Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Punta Cana is situated on pristine sugar white sands stretching 121-acres along Macao Beach in the Dominican Republic. Hard Rock’s first all inclusive hotel and casino exudes lavish five-star amenities and personal service to create the ultimate rock star getaway. Among the resort’s many offerings are luxe accommodations, the signature Rock Spa®, 18-hole Nicklaus designed golf course, iconic music memorabilia and a larger-than-life Vegas-style casino – the largest in the Dominican Republic, featuring Oro nightclub. Guests also enjoy 15 expansive pools, four swim-up bars, a kids pool and lazy river. A variety of gourmet dining options are available through the resort’s nine restaurants, with Mansion by Simon by the famed Rock n Roll Chef Kerry Simon, set to open in 2013. The property also features more than 65,000 square-feet of flexible event and meeting space.
